text: besides , his probity was irreproachable , in an age in which soldiers compromised so easily with their religion and their consciences , lovers with the rigorous delicacy of our era , and the poor with god ’s seventh commandment .

" besides , the wire is broken , " added herbert , showing that the wire had been snapped .
besides , the colonists had still at their disposal the little grotto above the great cavern , which was like the garret of the new dwelling .
besides , the wheels of a carriage , which appeared to have come from paris , had made a deep impression in the soft earth , which did not extend beyond the pavilion , but turned again toward paris .
besides , it did not offer the same security , and its tenants , notwithstanding their watchfulness , were here always in fear of some shot from the convicts .
